reviews.review_msg: book is only useful for assignments. notes are very clear. give enough practice questions and clear answer. always available for help. the whole course is easy except the final.

He is the best professor in my entire life. He explained concepts clearly with excellent examples. He repeated what he said sometimes, but it helped you to remember it, and you will also know it is an important topic. He is way too nice to his students. Even if he is very smart, he always teaches and thinks from students' side. He is the prof that

Very helpful in answering your questions (only face-to-face since he doesn't reply emails). Explained concepts well (I liked how he repeated what he said a few times). Exams were fair - the structure was very similar to sample exams so you have to do them in order to do well.

He is clear in everything he says, because he repeats the same sentence in three different ways so it sticks to your mind!  Complicated concepts explained clearly.  Helpful when approached with meaningful questions.  Overall, best finance prof one can get.
Excellent teacher
He's my favorite teacher
Great prof!  Very good at actually TEACHING, rather than lecturing everyone to death.  Best finance prof at SFU.
He's a great teacher and one of the best profs I've had at SFU.  Knows his stuff.
He's good at teaching...but the stuff he teaches is quite hard...overall, he is the best compared to other finance profs.
No Comments
Although his exams are difficult, he teaches really well and he is really nice professor

Really good professor. Very very helpful. He knows the course material very well.  Excellent prof. to learn finance from! Exams are not too difficult although they require some thought and clear understanding of course material. must attend lecture
Great lectures. VERY clear,difficult exams though.If you want to learn something take it with this professor/

He is really boring; only big finance enthusiasts can listen to him for the entire lecture. He is not even trying to engage everyone or let us work in pairs/groups or participate in any way. He is very academic - all his example come from the papers he read; not real work. Throws tons of information at you but all you need is numeric tasks.
Smart guy, but when he talks, it's difficult to hear him well. Make sure you sit in the front row otherwise you may easily get distracted especially when he doesn't speak very clearly

He's knowledgeable, but could try to spice things up a little. He gives 4 "pop" quizes, but you can tell or he'll tell you when but they're quite difficult. You must pay attention to the details in his class and you'll do well. Overall, he's a solid teacher, I'd recommend him. (I did poorly on all his quizes but pulled off B overall with the final)
No Comments
No Comments

the course itself is interesting but even though the prof is knowledgeable, his presentation method is so phlegmatic that it puts me to sleep... but you have to work hard and stay on top on things. practice questions  done in class give a good indication of what to expect on the modterm.
overall, not bad.

Patrick is one of the best professors at SFU for Finance. He has extensive industry experience through running his own boutique investment firm. He focuses helping students understand core and nececessary concepts and not just regurgitating the text. Strongly recommended for any student who wants to succeed in Finance, to learn from Patrick.

Patrick is very knowledgeable and easy-going. Gives sufficient feedback on exercises. He talks about many real life examples (e.g. projects he has done) to show how the textbook knowledge can be applied in real world. He cares about the analysis of financial data, which we need to know when go to work. definitely enjoyed his class.
i found him a very good professor. He was always available to explain when I did not grasp the concepts myself.
Use the textbook to study for tests; there are questions that he does not prepare you for. Quizzes are relatively easy.

You get out what you put in. While I had to spend A LOT of time and work on this class, I learned SO MUCH and got a good grade. He expects students to do more than just show up to class to understand the concepts as they are involved. Study by yourself, keep up with the project, ask questions. He isn't that bad if you put the time in.

Midterm was similar to class examples but final was much harder because all topics discussed since Wk 1 were tested. The group project was a LOT of work and don't think you can finish it in 2 wks & get an A. I got average on midterm but pulled up my grade cause I studied hard for the final & constantly asked for his feedback while writing the paper

Best Professor Ever. I always sat in the first row in his lectures to hear him better. 100 % clear explanations to every single piece. Very good teacher. I was encouraged a lot. 100% accessible. I used to have many many questions. But he was always nice and patient to answer questions. Very very nice prof.
